intro: Tibouchina karstenii, commonly known as the purple glorybower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored bracts that resemble flowers. The plant produces small, white, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Tibouchina karstenii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
